Transitional Justice for Gaza (TJG) is an initiative to cure the inefficiency and bias of the international order with the ultimate purpose of delivering transitional justice to the victims and survivors of Gaza who suffered from the Israeli attackes on and after 07 October 2023.

TJG is a not-for-profit organization that achieves its aims through recruiting, and coordinating the volunteered efforts of, the experts in the relevant domains, e.g. geospatial, digital forensics, database, cybersecurity, and international criminal law and investigations. TJG provides a channel for pro-Palestine individuals with the right expertise to contribute to these just cause and ends.

Volunteer!

The events on and after 07 October 2023 in Gaza have shocked, to the core, the collective conscious of humanity. On 31 October 2023, the United Nations labeled Gaza as “a graveyard for thousands of children”. Until 16 December 2023, the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs reported over 18,800 innocent civilians in Gaza were killed, over 51,000 were injured, over 52,000 housing units were destroyed, and over 1.9 million, out of 2,098,389, were internally displaced.

Prosecution & Accountability

TJG works on producing trial-ready linkage, crime-base, and circumstantial evidence in relation to the atrocities in Gaza. TJG aims at pursuing all avenues according to a predetermined, but dynamic, investigation plan that covers all elements of the crime of genocide.

More Info
Prosecution & Accountability

The management of TJG will forward the evidence, or items thereof, to the Prosecutors in relevant jurisdictions, including the ICC and/or the national courts with universal jurisdictions, subject to the following considerations:

  • Whether the court of competent jurisdiction is independent, unbiased, and operates within a functional judicial system;
  • The assurances received regarding the court’s procedures and internal controls related to data protection, retention, and processing; and
  • The approvals of relevant stakeholders, including victims, witnesses, and other sources of the evidence and the intelligence gathered.

Truth & Acknowledgement

TJG is working on providing the true narrative, supported by evidence, of what happened in, and to, Gaza on and after 07 October 2023. The narrative will be presented, and regularly updated, to the public.

More Info
Truth & Acknowledgement

The aim is to:

  • Counter and refute the misinformation by the Israeli propaganda;
  • Publicly acknowledge the harm done by IDF to the Population of Gaza;
  • Help the current and future generations to keep remembering and educating them on the atrocities committed in Gaza; and
  • Establish a starting point and an initial roadmap for individual and collective reparations.

Reparations

TJG works on documenting and quantifying pecuniary and non-pecuniary losses and will pursue every possible avenue to provide the needed reparations to the victims of the Israeli atrocities in Gaza.

More Info
Reparations

Those responsible for causing the atrocities in Gaza should:

  • Compensate for any damage in civilian properties and infrastructure that were specifically targeted by IDF;
  • Pay for all medical and support expenses for the rehabilitation of the civilian victims who were specifically targeted by IDF;
  • Financially compensate Gaza families and the civil societies for human losses that cannot and should not be considered “collateral damage”; and
  • Restore hospitals, schools, mosques, and churches that IDF damaged, bombed, attacked, and/or took control over without valid evidence that they were used as basis of hostilities.

In parallel with such efforts, TJG is recruiting and coordinating with volunteering experts in mental health to aid traumatized children in Gaza to navigate such extremely difficult situation.
